channel.title: Convergence. House Music. Trance. Electro. Deep House.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Convergence - An irregular, but extraordinary, podcast.
channel.itunes:author: dj_t6
channel.itunes:summary: A transcendental journey through the world of house music and it's derivatives. Genres represented include deep house, trance, commercial, tech-house, acid house, and house of every other flavor.
channel.description: A transcendental journey through the world of house music and it's derivatives. Genres represented include deep house, trance, commercial, tech-house, acid house, and house of every other flavor.

item.title: Motion - Volume 9
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: Continuing the Motion series' legacy of excellent trance, this one brings forth today's best trance ballads. Features Aruna, Afargan, Andy Moor, Tydi, and the requisite appearance by Tritonal.
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Uptown - Volume 1

item.itunes:subtitle: A change of pace on this month's mix. Slowing down to a little downtempo/lounge. While we may slow down the BPM, we're still keeping it funky with artists such as Micah, JK Soul, and Jay Denes.

item.title: Motion - Volume 5
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: Cycling through today's relevant trance hits...featuring Julie Thompson's Falling, Jes, Bt, Robbie Rivera Featuring Lizzie Curious, and Morgan Page.
item.itunes:summary:
Cycling through today's relevant trance hits. Somewhere along the way I missed out on Julie Thompson's Falling but I caught up...it is a piece of art! In addition to that, I've laid down excellent tracks from Jes, Bt, Robbie Rivera Featuring Lizzie Curious, and Morgan Page.

item.title: Deepness - Volume 4
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: The latest in deep house...staring out with an experimental electro vibe, this one moves quickly to build into a bass meltdown. Features Trentemoller, Ethyl and Flor, and my fav of the day Karol XVII & MB Valence's slamming "Snatches."
item.itunes:summary:
The latest in deep house...staring out with an experimental electro vibe, this one moves quickly to build into a bass meltdown. Features Trentemoller, Ethyl and Flor, and my fav of the day Karol XVII & MB Valence's slamming "Snatches." Also - can't miss Samantha James as she rocks it "Subconscious" style.
SONG LIST 1 Trentemoller Physical Fraction Martinez Taking It Deep Edit Audiomatique Recordings 2 Gorge Feat The Writers Poet Erotic Soul Original mix 8Bit 3 Sezer Uvsal and Evren Ulusov Singing In The Bathtub Original Mix Loco Records 4 Chase Buch You Gotta Original Mix Kote Records 5 Ethyl Flori Malmoe Original Mix Quintessentials 6 Karol XVII & MB Valence Snatches Soul Minority Remix Loco Records 7 JML Into The Wild Peter Horrevorts Big Five Remix BEEF Records 8 Wolf + Lamb I'm Original Mix Wolf + Lamb Records 9 Kevin Yost and Peter Funk Trust Main Voxed Version I Records 10 Samantha James Subconscious Nacho Marco Remix OM Records 11 Jean Jacques Smoothie Feat Tara Busch 2People 2010 Rework In The House / Defected

item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: BAM! Here we go with the latest in commercial breakouts...Rihanna's "S & M," Hannah's "Sanity," Taio Cruz's "Higher," a comeback from India "Tacalacateo." Selections here bring back visions of 80s power mixes!
item.itunes:summary:
BAM! Here we go with the latest in commercial breakouts...Rihanna's "S & M," Hannah's "Sanity," Taio Cruz's "Higher," a comeback from India "Tacalacateo," Kat Deluna's "Dancing Tonight," and I had to dust off an oldie but goodie: Chocolate Puma's "I Wanna Be You." Selections here bring back visions of 80s power mixes!

item.title: Muy Comercial - Volume 9
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: Another episode of the commercially-focused Muy Comercial series. Features Peter Brown, Mark Knight, Andrea Carnell, Carmen Perez, and a four-turntable tribal extravaganza that crests with Bebe Zahara Benet.
item.itunes:summary:
Another episode of the commercially-focused Muy Comercial series...this one focusing on tribal elements. Features Peter Brown, Mark Knight, Andrea Carnell, Carmen Perez, and a three-turntable set in the second half hour that ultimately crests with a four-turntable tribal freakshow featuring Bebe Zahara Benet's "I'm The Shit."
For a more visually-friendly song list and credits, see http://www.ethijs.com/music/mixes_detail.aspx?mix_id=dj_t6%20-%20Muy%20Comercial%20-%20Volume%209

item.title: Accelerate
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: A high-bpm mix of of today's best trance. This episode features a couple of special tracks from Holiday Rain, a local Denver artist who is up an coming. Also included are Patraxx Elusun, DJ Eco, Sub6, Faruk Sabanci & Aeden, and Trilucid.
item.itunes:summary:
A high-bpm mix of of today's best trance. This episode features a couple of special tracks from Holiday Rain, who is an emerging artist here in Denver. (see http://www.holidayrain.com for more) This episode also features Patraxx Elusun, DJ Eco, Sub6, Faruk Sabanci & Aeden, and Trilucid.

item.title: Muy Comercial - Volume 7
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: Number 7 of the Muy Comercial series of commercial music. This episode has an electro influence to the music and features pop hits from Empire Of The Sun, Plumb, Tik Tok, and my current commercial fav from the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.
item.itunes:summary:
Number 7 of the Muy Comercial series of commercial music. This episode has an electro influence to the music and features pop hits from Empire Of The Sun, a retro-based remix of Plumb's "Hang On," Tik Tok, and my current commercial fav that is rocking an electro-retro-punk feel, "Heads Will Roll" from the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.
For a more visually-friendly song list and credits, see http://www.ethijs.com/music/mixes_detail.aspx?mix_id=dj_t6%20-%20Muy%20Comercial%20-%20Volume%207

item.title: Looking North - Part 1
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: First in a three part trance series. Some fast movers on this collection. Features Tomas Bronzwaer, Andy Blueman, John O'Callaghan, Simon Patterson, and Jan Oostdyk, and a great remix of Cary Brothers' Ride by Tiesto.
item.itunes:summary:
First in a three part trance series. Some fast movers on this collection. Features Tomas Bronzwaer, Andy Blueman, John O'Callaghan, Simon Patterson, and Jan Oostdyk, and a great remix of Cary Brothers' Ride by Tiesto. Peaks and valleys on this one and I have to say this is one of my favs of late. Enjoy!

item.title: Shift Red
item.itunes:author: dj_t6
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy Holidays ALL! Here is a little present for ya...I'm bringing back a mix from yesteryear 2002. Features X-Press2, The Morne Featuring Lee John, G Pal Presents Ghos, Elisa, and a grand finale with a masterpiece from Evolution Featuring Jayn Hanna.
item.itunes:summary:
Happy Holidays ALL! Here is a little present for ya...an out of cycle podcast! As you know, Convergence is on a monthly schedule. Well, I've got music coming out of my ears so starting now and going for little while I'm breaking that schedule and going bi-weekly on a temporary basis - probably until about February or March. Despite the new tunes in waiting, for this podcast I'm bringing back a mix from yesteryear 2002. This is a smooth mix that has it's roots in a 1990s-era club called Red in D.C.. Red provided a barebones approach to clubbing...a basement club (yea, TRULY underground!) with a thundering sound system and candlelight. It took the focus off of flashy lights and decor and put it where it belonged (IMHO): on the music and on the dancefloor. This podcast features X-Press2, The Morne Featuring Lee John, G Pal Presents Ghos, Elisa, and a grand finale with one of my all-time favs a masterpiece from Evolution Featuring Jayn Hanna.
SONG LIST:
1 X-Press2 I Want You Back Skint 2 Moshic Indian Moon PitchBlack 3 The Morne Feat.
